revised_title: Prokaryotic DNA Replication Mechanisms and Their Implications for Eukaryotic Systems
tldr: The article discusses the molecular mechanisms of prokaryotic DNA replication, focusing on the replication systems of bacterial chromosomes and bacteriophages. It highlights the role of the self-correcting DNA polymerase and the primosome in the replication process, as well as the discontinuous synthesis of the lagging strand, which generates Okazaki fragments. The findings from prokaryotic systems provide insights into the DNA replication process in eukaryotic cells.
